verses.verse: Now there was a man<WH376> of Benjamin,<WH1144> whose name<WH8034> was Kish,<WH7027> the son<WH1121> of Abiel,<WH22> the son<WH1121> of Zeror,<WH6872> the son<WH1121> of Becorath,<WH1064> the son<WH1121> of Aphiah,<WH647> the son of a Benjamite,<WH1145> a mighty<WH1368> man<WH376> of valor.<WH2428>

He had a son,<WH1121> whose name<WH8034> was Saul,<WH7586> an impressive<WH2896> young man;<WH970> and there was not among the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> a better<WH2896> person<WH376> than he.<WH7926> From his shoulders and upward<WH4605> he was higher<WH1364> than any of the people.<WH5971>

The donkeys<WH860> of Kish,<WH7027> Saul<WH7586>'s father,<WH1> were lost.<WH6> Kish<WH7027> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586> his son,<WH1121> "Take<WH3947> now one<WH259> of the servants<WH5288> with you,<WH6965> and arise, go<WH3212> seek<WH1245> the donkeys.<WH860>"

He passed through<WH5674> the hill<WH2022> country of Ephraim,<WH669> and passed through<WH5674> the land<WH776> of Shalishah,<WH8031> but they didn't<WH4672> find them:<WH5674> then they passed through the land<WH776> of Shaalim,<WH8171> and there they weren't<WH5674> there: and he passed through the land<WH776> of the Benjamites,<WH1145> but they didn't<WH4672> find them.

When they had come<WH935> to the land<WH776> of Zuph,<WH6689> Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to his servant<WH5288> who was with him,<WH3212> "Come, and let us return,<WH7725> lest my father<WH1> stop<WH2308> caring about the donkeys,<WH860> and be anxious for us.<WH1672>"

He said<WH559> to him,<WH5892> "See now, there is in this city a man<WH376> of God,<WH430> and he is a man<WH376> who is held in honor.<WH3513> All that he says<WH1696> comes<WH935> surely to pass.<WH935> Now let us go<WH3212> there.<WH5046> Perhaps he can tell us concerning our journey<WH1870> whereon we go.<WH1980>"

Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to his servant,<WH5288> "But,<WH3212> behold, if we go, what shall we bring<WH935> the man?<WH376> For the bread<WH3899> is spent<WH235> in our vessels,<WH3627> and there is not a present<WH8670> to bring<WH935> to the man<WH376> of God.<WH430> What do we have?"

The servant<WH5288> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586> again,<WH3254> and said,<WH6030> "Behold,<WH4672> I have in my hand<WH3027> the fourth part<WH7253> of a shekel<WH8255> of silver.<WH3701> I will give<WH5414> that to the man<WH376> of God,<WH430> to tell<WH5046> us our way.<WH1870>"

(In earlier times in Israel,<WH3478> when a man<WH376> went<WH3212> to inquire<WH1875> of God,<WH430> thus he said,<WH559> "Come,<WH3212> and let us go<WH3212> to the seer;<WH7200>" for he who is now<WH3117> called<WH7121> a prophet<WH5030> was before<WH6440> called<WH7121> a Seer.<WH7200>)
Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH1697> to his servant,<WH5288> "Well<WH2896> said.<WH559> Come,<WH3212> let us go.<WH3212>" So they went<WH3212> to the city<WH5892> where the man<WH376> of God was.<WH430>

As they went up<WH5927> the ascent<WH5927> to the city,<WH5892> they found<WH4672> young maidens<WH5291> going out<WH3318> to draw<WH7579> water,<WH4325> and said<WH559> to them,<WH3426> "Is the seer here?<WH7200>"

They answered<WH6030> them,<WH6030> and said, "He is.<WH3426> Behold,<WH3426> he is before<WH6440> you.<WH4116> Hurry now,<WH935> for he has come today<WH3117> into the city;<WH5892> for the people have a sacrifice<WH2077> today<WH3117> in the high place.<WH1116>

As soon as you have come<WH935> into the city,<WH5892> you shall immediately<WH3651> find<WH4672> him,<WH5927> before he goes up to the high place<WH1116> to eat;<WH398> for the people<WH5971> will not eat<WH398> until he come,<WH935> because he blesses<WH1288> the sacrifice.<WH2077> Afterwards<WH310> those who are invited<WH7121> eat.<WH398> Now therefore go up;<WH5927> for at this time<WH3117> you shall find him.<WH4672>"
They went up<WH5927> to<WH8432> the city.<WH5892> As they came<WH935> within the city,<WH5892> behold,<WH8050> Samuel came out<WH3318> toward<WH7125> them,<WH5927> to go up to the high place.<WH1116>
Now Yahweh<WH3068> had revealed<WH1540> to<WH241> Samuel<WH8050> a<WH259> day<WH3117> before<WH6440> Saul<WH7586> came,<WH935> saying,<WH559>

"Tomorrow<WH4279> about this time<WH6256> I will send<WH7971> you a man<WH376> out of the land<WH776> of Benjamin,<WH1144> and you shall anoint<WH4886> him to be prince<WH5057> over my people<WH5971> Israel;<WH3478> and he shall save<WH3467> my people<WH5971> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines:<WH6430> for I have looked<WH7200> on my people,<WH5971> because their cry<WH6818> has come to me.<WH935>"

When Samuel<WH8050> saw<WH7200> Saul,<WH7586> Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH6030> to him,<WH376> "Behold, the man of whom I spoke<WH559> to you!<WH6113> this same shall have authority over my people.<WH5971>"
Then Saul<WH7586> drew near<WH5066> to Samuel<WH8050> in<WH8432> the gate,<WH8179> and said,<WH559> "Please tell<WH5046> me where<WH335> the seer<WH7200>'s house is.<WH1004>"

Samuel<WH8050> answered<WH6030> Saul,<WH7586> and said,<WH6030> "I am the seer.<WH7200> Go up<WH5927> before<WH6440> me to the high place,<WH1116> for you shall eat<WH398> with me today.<WH3117> In the morning<WH1242> I will let you go,<WH7971> and will tell<WH5046> you all that is in your heart.<WH3824>

As for your donkeys<WH860> who were lost<WH6> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> ago,<WH3117> don't<WH7760> set your mind<WH3820> on them;<WH4672> for they are found. For whom is all that is desirable<WH2532> in Israel?<WH3478> Is it not for you,<WH1> and for all your father's house?<WH1004>"

Saul<WH7586> answered,<WH6030> "Am I not a Benjamite,<WH1145> of the smallest<WH6996> of the tribes<WH7626> of Israel?<WH3478> And my family<WH4940> the least<WH6810> of all the families<WH4940> of the tribe<WH7626> of Benjamin?<WH1144> Why then do you speak<WH1696> to me like this?<WH1697>"

Samuel<WH8050> took<WH3947> Saul<WH7586> and his servant,<WH5288> and brought<WH935> them into the guest room,<WH3957> and made them sit<WH5414> in the best<WH7218> place<WH4725> among those who were invited,<WH7121> who were about thirty<WH7970> persons.<WH376>
Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to the cook,<WH2876> "Bring<WH5414> the portion<WH4490> which I gave<WH5414> you,<WH559> of which I said to you,<WH7760> 'Set it aside.'"

The cook<WH2876> took up<WH7311> the thigh,<WH7785> and that which was on it,<WH7760> and set it before<WH6440> Saul.<WH7586> Samuel said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH7604> that which has been reserved! Set<WH7760> it before<WH6440> yourself and eat;<WH398> because for the appointed time<WH4150> has it been kept<WH8104> for you,<WH559> for I said, <WH7121> 'I have invited the people.<WH5971>'" So Saul<WH7586> ate<WH398> with Samuel<WH8050> that day.<WH3117>
When they had come down<WH3381> from the high place<WH1116> into the city,<WH5892> he talked<WH1696> with Saul<WH7586> on the housetop.<WH1406>

They arose early:<WH7925> and it happened about the spring<WH5927> of the day,<WH7837> that Samuel<WH8050> called<WH7121> to Saul<WH7586> on the housetop,<WH1406> saying,<WH559> "Get up,<WH6965> that I may send you away.<WH7971>" Saul<WH7586> arose,<WH6965> and they went out<WH3318> both<WH8147> of them,<WH8050> he and Samuel, abroad.<WH2351>

As they were going down<WH3381> at the end<WH7097> of the city,<WH5892> Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "Tell<WH559> the servant<WH5288> pass on<WH5674> before<WH6440> us<WH5674>" (and he passed on), "but stand<WH5975> still first,<WH3117> that I may cause you to hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of God.<WH430>"
